Name: Daiquiri No. 2
Ingredients: 60 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
10 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water) optional
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Review: A Daiquiri with subtle orange notes, but far from being a mere Orange Daiquiri .
History: Created circa 1915 by created by Constantino "Constante" Ribalaïgua Vert, who owned Havana's famous El Floridita from 1918 to 1952, this is the second of four numbered daiquiris in the 1934 1st edition Bar La Florida Cocktails , menu book.
Nutrition: One serving of Daiquiri No. 2 contains 178 calories
